description: Change the registrant of a domain name. For certain TLDs, the registrant cannot be changed via the ModifyDomain command, but only explicitly using this TradeDomain command.
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: TradeDomain
Domain Name
Contact Handle of the new domain owner.This parameter is required if a trade is requested (ACTION=request), if a pending trade is canceled (ACTION=cancel) this parameter is not mandatory.
Trade order action:CREATE - create a trade orderREPLACE - replace a trade orderUPDATE - update a trade order

Trade order ID. Will only be considered if the parameter ORDER is set to REPLACE or UPDATE. If the parameter is not stated and the parameter ORDER is set to REPLACE or UPDATE then an auto detection of the order ID will be done.
Contact Handle of the new domain admin
Contact Handle of the new technical contact
Contact Handle of the new billing contact
Nameserver Hostname
The domain's authorization code
Nameserver hostnames and IP addresses

Defines the action to perform. Supported values are:request: Request a new ownership change (parameter OWNERCONTACT mandatory)cancel: Cancel a pending Trade (parameter OWNERCONTACT not mandatory)The default value is request
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions of a highly regulated TLD
IRTP parameter: By setting this to 1 you confirm that you are the current registrant or the respective Designated Agent (DA) and that you authorize the change of the registrant
IRTP parameter: By setting this to 1 you confirm that you are the new registrant or the respective Designated Agent (DA) and that you authorize the change of the registrant
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions of a highly regulated TLD
IRTP parameter: By setting this to 1 you can disable the 60 day transfer lock upon a successful registrant change
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions; only relevant for .AE domains
Registrant's name; only relevant for .AE domains
Registrant's ID type; only relevant for .AE domains
Registrant's ID number; only relevant for .AE domains

Registration eligibility name; only relevant for .AE domains
Registration eligibility ID type; only relevant for .AE domains
Registration eligibility ID number; only relevant for .AE domains
Registration reason; only relevant for .AE domains
The respective ID number depending on the registrant ID type
The ID Type can be one of the following:ABN: Australian Business NumberACN:  Australian Company NumberRBN: Business Registration NumberTM:  Trademark Number
paramaters.Type: ABN, ACN, RBN, TM or OTHER

paramaters.Definition: The legal type of the domain owner
The registrant contact's language (default is EN)
Parameter describing the intended use for the domain name
Set 1 to accept the terms and condition of a individual registration, mandatory if the registrant is an individual
Registrant's legal form

Set this parameter to 1 to use our Trustee Contact Service for the Owner-C, if you can't provide a local presence in the EU
Registrant's personal or organizational identification number; only relevant for .FI domains
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions
Type of company applying for an .FI domain; possible values:0: Private person1: Company (default)2: Association3: Foundation4: Municipality5: Political party6: State7: Public corporation

The DUNS number is a nine-digit number, issued by Dun & Bradstreet. DUNS is the abbreviation of Data Universal Numbering System. Companies with a valid DUNS number are still obliged having their head office in the territory of the European Union. The DUNS number can be provided using this parameter
Companies with a local identifier specific to a country of the European Economic Area can provide their local identifier using this parameter
Company name in Chinese

Must be one of the following for individuals:HKID: Hong Kong Identity NumberOTHID: Other's Country Identity NumberPASSNO: Passport No.BIRTHCERT: Birth CertificateOTHIDV: Others Individual DocumentMust be one of the following for organizations:BR: Business Registration CertificateCI: Certificate of IncorporationCRES: Certificate of Registration of a SchoolHKSARG: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government Department HKORDINANCE: Ordinance of Hong KongOTHORG: Others Organization Document
Type of document if other document was chosen
The respective document number
ISO-3166 Country Code
Registrant's birth date, mandatory if the registrant is an individual
Registrant's industry type; default is: 0 (not specified)
Set 1 to accept the terms and condition of a individual registration, mandatory if the registrant is an individual

The class of the registrant, following values are possible:Body Corporate (Ltd,PLC,Company)Constitutional Body Discretionary Applicant Natural Person School/Educational Institution Sole Trader Statutory Body Unincorporated Association

Based on the registrant class the registrant category has to state one of the following details:Body Corporate (Ltd,PLC,Company): Corporate Name, Discretionary Name, Publication Name, Registered Business Name, Registered Trade Mark NameConstitutional Body: Discretionary Name, Publication Name, Registered Trade Mark Name, State Agency NameDiscretionary Applicant: Discretionary NameNatural Person: Discretionary Name, Personal Name, Politician's Name, Registered Trade Mark NameSchool/Educational Institution: Discretionary Name, Publication Name, Registered Trade Mark Name, School/Educational Institution NameSole Trader: Discretionary Name, Personal Trading Name, Publication Name, Registered Business Name, Registered Trade Mark NameStatutory Body: Discretionary Name, Publication Name, Registered Trade Mark Name, State Agency NameUnincorporated Association: Discretionary Name, Publication Name, Registered Business Name, Registered Trade Mark Name, Unincorporated Association Name
Trade mark number or VAT-ID

If the registrant is an individual, the PIN has to be:  The registrant's fiscal code or  the number of an identity documentIf  the registrant is an organization, the PIN has to be: The company's fiscal code or the company's VAT number

In some special cases you need to specify the exact entity type of the registrant:1: Italian and foreign natural persons2: Italian Companies / one man companies3:  freelance workers / professionals 4: non-profit organizations5: public organizations6:  	other subjects7: foreigners who match 2 - 6

This number must be provided for individuals as well as for organizations. For individuals or companies located in Sweden a valid Swedish personal or organizational number must be stated (6 digits, dash, 4 digits). For individuals and companies outside of Sweden the ID number (e.g. Civic registration number, company registration number, or the equivalent) can consist of 4 to 123 characters.
The VAT-ID has to be stated for companies that are located inside the European Union but outside Sweden

The registrant of the domain must one of 3 criteria:A: New South Wales EntitiesB: New South Wales ResidentsC: Associated Entities
The registrant of the domain must one of 3 criteria:A: Victorian EntitiesB: Victorian ResidentsC: Associated Entities
Must be one of the following: P1: Business use for profit P2: Non-profit business, club, association, religious organization, etc.P3: Personal use P4: Education purposes  P5: Government purposes

Must be one of the following: C11: a United States citizen C12: a permanent resident of the United States of America or any of its posessions or territories.  C21: U.S. Organization incorporated within one of the 50 states or a U.S. Territory An entity or organization that has a bona fide presence in the United States of America or any of its possessions or territories. C31:  Regularly engages in lawful activities (sales of goods or services or other business, commercial or non-commercial, including not-for-profit relations in the United States)  C32: Entity has an office or other facility in the US.
Specify the two-letter country-code of the registrant (if Nexus Category is either C31 or C32)
